data.event: The first bridge on the site was opened in 1817 and the current bridge was opened in 1945.
The first bridge on the site was opened in 1817 and the current bridge was opened in 1945.
The Church of St John the Evangelist, Waterloo Road was constructed from 1822 by the Commissioners for Building New Churches as the population of the parish of Lambeth had significantly increased.

event.title: 1848 the locality around the station and Lower Marsh became

data.event: After the opening of Waterloo railway station in 1848 the locality around the station and Lower Marsh became known as Waterloo.

The boundary of the ecclesiastical parish of St John Waterloo established in 1824 was formed by the River Thames in the north and west, approximated Westminster Bridge Road in the south, and followed the boundary with Southwark in the east.
